meanings.definition: A feeling of disappointment or letdown after a period of excitement or euphoria.
meanings.sent1: After the big party, I experienced a comedown when I realized it was over.
meanings.sent2: The comedown after winning the game was hard to bear.
meanings.sent3: The comedown from the thrilling movie left me feeling a bit sad.
meanings.sent4: The comedown from the exciting vacation was like a sudden drop in mood.
meanings.sent5: The comedown hit me like a wave of sadness crashing over me.

meanings.definition: To descend from a higher position or level.
meanings.sent1: I slowly comedown from the tree after picking the ripe fruits.
meanings.sent2: The airplane will comedown gently on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel comedown the tree trunk in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the temperature starts to comedown.
meanings.sent5: The elevator began to comedown smoothly to the ground floor.
